statement.title: # Content
statement.content: Given an Array $A$ with length $N$ ($1 \leq N \leq 5 \cdot 10^5$), find a longest consecutive sub-interval on Array $A$ satisfied that there is no more than 1 minimum number and no more than 1 maximum number in the sub-interval.

statement.title: # Standard Input
statement.content:
The first line contains an integer $N$ ($1 \leq N \leq 5 \cdot 10^5$) meaning the length of Array $A$.

The second line contains $N$ integers $A_1, A_2 , .... ,A_n$ ($-10^9 \leq A_i \leq 10^9$).

statement.title: # Standard Output
statement.content:
Output two integers $L$ and $From$ representing the length of the longest consecutive sub-interval on Array $A$ satisfied the condition and the starting position in Array $A$ (starts from 1).

If there are multiple answers, you can output any of them.

statement.title: # Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
1 101 1
10 8 3 2 5 2 3 4 6 3 66 4
10 -1 2 -1 2 1 1 2 -1 0 06 5
